title: Coding Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. It took a while to hear anything back from HR about a job offer, but the coding leadership is very nice. Very laid back and comfortable interview.
Interview Questions: What type of leadership style do you have?

title: Front Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: It was on zoom. They ask questions about your performance and what you will add to the team. I got on Zoom and waited to be put in the breakout room with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: What will you contribute to the team?

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Easy, not very stressful, nice interviewer and asked basic questions about scheduling, availability, etc. Easy hiring process. The pay is not great but it's campus dining after all. Nice coworkers.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: A number of long virtual interviews. Process is changing to not make interviewing an all-day event. A mixture of group and individual interviews. Start with HR reps, meet with department heads and staff.
Interview Questions: DEI Questions Skills Explain work history

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone/zoom interview. Then the in-person interview ended up being a 4 hour panel interview which was not communicated in advance. I had to make child care arrangements on the fly between sessions
Interview Questions: Can you handle confidential information?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: 1-hour video call with two professors. each professor interviews for 30 minutes. they ask questions related to motivation, behavior, academic interest, research projects, etc. that's it. nothing to be worried about so keep calm and try to present your true self!
Interview Questions: tell me about your self and your interests

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Was good and simple. Very straight forward directly with the research supervisor. There was no followup with the university or department administration though. May vary between labs and between departments and units of the school.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Reimbursement Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR and then supervisor of team. After that process you are able to meet and discuss the roles and responsibilities. I was very pleased with this process. I found that the company was very organized.
Interview Questions: How are you doing today?

title: Club Sports Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Two stage interview process when I was a student at The University of Missouri from 2015-2019. We needed a resume, cover letter and references pages. Every interviewer was friendly and was a great first time interview experience for those who wish to work during the school year.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have to be a club sports associate?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, video interview, in person all day interview that included meetings with various stakeholders. Professionals, students, coworkers, supervisor and campus partners. The entire process took 2 months. It was extensive.
Interview Questions: What is your advisory style for students?

title: Instructional Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via Zoom in Aug 2022. They each introduced themselves and then took turns asking predetermined questions. Honestly it was a lovely interview and then they just ghosted me after telling me I would hear back within 2 weeks. Never even got a rejection email. I was so disappointed because I thought it went really well and this job would be perfect for me (and vice versa).
Interview Questions: Whether I had experience with Canvas LMS.

title: Campus Dining Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Interview was super quick, one you arrive you wait in the waiting area and then someone comes out to greet you.  and the interviewer was extremely helpful during the entire process. I was hired right not the spot.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with upset customers?

title: Graduate TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: There is not an interview to be a graduate teaching assistant in the College of Engineering. You apply with your preferences for courses and your previous grades in those courses and are selected based off of that.
Interview Questions: They asked me what class I would prefer

title: Marketing and Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward with typical interview questions. The individuals who interviewed me were super nice and really had an interest in what I had to say. There was no awkward pauses or judgement from them. I could tell they were trying to figure out if I would be a good fit for the team.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to learn from this role?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a laid-back interview process, very conversational. I did not feel very stressed throughout the process. I could tell the interviewers wanted me to feel comfortable and actually wanted me to do well during the interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Strength and weaknesses. Multiple questions about hypothetical situations

title: Office Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: A few rounds of questions, very simple panel of interviewers that asked me questions about challenges, decisions, and past experience. They were very professional. There was only one face to face interview.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge you have faced?

title: TigerTech Service Desk Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward starting with more personal questions leading into questions that reflected my experience and prior knowledge that regarded troubleshooting and things such as my knowledge on different operating systems.
Interview Questions: What does it mean when a MacBook turns on but only shows a folder with a question mark ?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone screening interview about 2 weeks after online application.  They asked the "tell me about yourself" type questions. So have your "elevator" speech down - the basic outline of your resume. They won't ask anything specific about your background because it's probably an HR person who just wants to get a feel for you. I decided to not move forward because it's not a good fit.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What do you want to apply this role? 
What experience you had to bring to the team.

title: Career Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple overall, called in for two face to face meetings, basic questions overall, had to give a presentation, seemed to take a long time though to receive response. Did research on university and unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, how do you build rapport with students, conflict, strengths, something to improve upon.

title: Customer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with the three scientists, one in person interview with the three scientists I would be working for. The phone lasted about 20 minutes and the in-person for lasted for about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Can you work with Qualitrics?

title: Coordniator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was during covid so a virtual campus visit/ interview. I was invited to meet with students, stakeholders, office staff, and a myriad of others. This was a well rounded process and left me feeling excited for what was to come.
Interview Questions: They asked average questions and nothing caught me off guard or surprised me.

title: Economics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Conversational interview with the supervisor. We talked and I asked about her background and current challenges facing the learning center. Not difficult at all. Also be sure to have questions prepared to ask the interviewer, show you're interested
Interview Questions: How would you communicate with a difficult student?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: From the beginning, they asked me very specific questions about my role, experience and motivation to change. I always had to provide examples on how I manage my skills in my job. The often insist on the fact that Amazon is "frugal", and they are very informal... to the extent  that this approach soon becomes "differently formal".
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: All of the questions were centered around my leadership experience, as well as how I would react to certain situations. Very straightforward questions and they use a point system that determines where you are put.
Interview Questions: How would I describe my leadership style?

title: Student Coordinator Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Beginning was great. They set up an interview quickly and hit the ground running with the process. However, after the interview, it took countless emails and a month worth of waiting to hear anything. Longest, unprofessional process I’ve ever been a part of.
Interview Questions: The basics. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Much longer than a typical interview process.  Lasted a full day meeting with many different employees.  For a first round interview, it seemed excessive and unecessary.  It also required the applicant to provide a presentation.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take to stay in communication with multiple departments?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: easy, great environment that helps people learn and grow as a professional. Would recommend working here for any students in particular that want a relaxed work place. The staff is all super friendly as well.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my application to the graduate school of the University of Missouri and then met with the research advisor and visit the research lab and discuss some research projects.
Interview Questions: what are your GPA and GRE?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very proper but not high stress. Met with immediate boss, their boss and two peers. Was asked job-related questions and given feedback immediately (will let know in approximately a week after other interviewees are done).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: One paper application and two interviews. The first interview is a group interview for an hour with group activities. The second interview is individual with more intense, and professional questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tour guide?

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a recruiter. She just asked questions about my history, why I wanted the job, what I expected from the company. The interview lasted approximately 30 minutes. After the interview the recruiter stated that if I am considered for the job I will need to go to student life, and I will be contacted by the hiring department via phone or email.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be part of the University?

title: SOS Temporary Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Word of mouth got me an early morning interview the next day with manager of MU Surgery Center that was going to close in a few months.  Spent 10 or 15 minutes with manager in her office.  Waiting to hear back from manager took several days which was longer than it took to get an interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in a clinic or hospital setting?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted less than 1 hr and consisted of a panel of 3 people, 1 of which was the director. Basic behavioral interview questions in a fairly relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to have a difficult conversation with a student. How do break bad news to students?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Short interview with professor and perhaps with lab members as well. As long as you seem at least somewhat knowledgable and interested, there's a good chance the professor will allow you to join if they have space.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this lab?

title: Nutrition Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Kansas City, MO) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Five minute presentation followed by an extensive list of somewhat redundant questions asked between two individuals from upper management . Not too stressful as both we pretty laid back!
Interview Questions: How do you plan on reaching out to potential sites partners?

title: Community Engagement Specialist In Nutrition Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Carrollton, MO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a fairly short application online. Once I was called for an interview they told me to prepare a 10 minute presentation on a nutrition education program I would implement. The interview took place in the rural MO town and there was a panel of about five people asking me questions for about an hour.
Interview Questions: Who is your kingmaker?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. I had an initial email to the hiring manager and then a phone interview and was offered the job a few days later. Phone interview was about 10 minutes long, I believe was just used to ensure that we could talk on the phone well.
Interview Questions: What has Mizzou given you the opportunity to do?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: skype phone no onsite interview Talk more about you research Prepare a good resume and cover letter skype phone no onsite interview Talk more about you research Prepare a good resume and cover letter
Interview Questions: Talk more about you research

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a friend introduce me to their boss and then I followed up with an Email to apply and was brought in for a short in person interview. Was hired on the spot after completing the one on one interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the position/ What do you hope to get out of it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Rolla, MO) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Does not have a interview process, works on the basis of courses taken as a graduate student or in under graduate studies. The grade secured does not matter. The understanding of the subject matter
Interview Questions: Did you take the course XXX?

title: Graduate Assistant Non Teaching Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process, depending on the department. It follows the basic behavioral based interview questions, but different departments add different questions. The on boarding process is fairly easy, the hardest part is getting a response from NES. Other than that, it was a good interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you did not agree with something, how did you handle that situation?

title: Admin Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: straight forward, apply online and then one in person interview. in person interview was not too difficult. took less than hour,  recommend for students who want an on campus job
Interview Questions: experince questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 min interview. The adviser asked about my past experience and how I can apply my knowledge to the job and whether the research will be useful for my career path later on.
Interview Questions: Will the research be useful for your career path later on?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First Round - A call with the direct supervisor of the position, lasted about 30 minutes. 
Final round - Group interview with direct supervisor, everyone within the department (Four people total). Each person asked roughly two questions.
Interview Questions:
- Tell us what you know about Missouri Athletics
- How did you promote a high draft prospect in your internship
- What can you bring to Missouri
- How would you come in and contribute right away

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy! Signed up for an interview slot online. Turnaround was quick! Questions were basic. Most people were easy to work with, sometimes there were communication errors since the Campus Activities Programming Board is largely student-run. It was cool to have a say in what kind of events were planned on campus, from speakers to concerts.
Interview Questions: What role do you take on in a team?

title: IT Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was no phone interview, the first interview was in person with two of the management members. Nothing too technical but basic IT questions involving knowledge of operating systems, hardware experience, and ability to troubleshoot and diagnose issues. It was not intensive, but covered a wide range of material.
Interview Questions: What operating systems are you good with and how would you rank your skill level?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Bureaucracy - I thought working for the state was bad.  They said they wanted to move fast, but the interview process took three months.  Screening interview, interviewed with a panel.  Still haven't hired anyone.
Interview Questions: They asked the set interview questions - why do you want this job, etc.

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great interview. Everyone was very friendly. Would recommend. Very clean facility. Modern work areas. Great break room. Training sounds extensive and they seem to work with you. Hours are manageable. No nights, weekends, or call. Good benefits.
Interview Questions: What makes you want this job?

title: Finance 1000 T Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a single interview after I submitted my application. Asked several behavioral and analytical questions. It was a very relaxed interview process and the gentleman who interviewed me was very personable. One of the easier interviews I have done.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good TA for Finance 1000?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The application process was lenghty and I didn't appreciate having to have references before I know whether they were interested in me as a candidate. The phone interview was fine and friendly.
Interview Questions: My experience with firing employees.

title: Director Athletic Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with Head and Associate Coaches individually. Also met the person currently in the position (set to leave a few weeks later) to understand the job fully. Toured Athletic centers and practice facilities.
Interview Questions:
Do you have experience working with donors and boosters? 
How do you plan to manage the demands of this job while earning your degree?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Need to take speak test and get a score from scale of 1-4 and our department will review the score and based on that they will assign TA to different subjects in the department.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself?

title: Nutrition Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: had to give a presentation about food and the benefits of it, and how important it is to work for the community, it took about 30 min, the presentation was on pretzy
Interview Questions: what do you think is the best of working in the community?

title: Student Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. They were in need of more students to fill positions so they asked me a question and then they started telling me what I would be doing there.
Interview Questions: What qualifications do you have?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They had me sit in a group interview and asked for availability. Very laid back and personable. The group interview tested your conversation skills. There were about 4 people in my group
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to interview in the first round of interviews, as such there were 8 questions more focused on getting to know you and your ability to work, not job specific questions.
Interview Questions: How do you measure success?

title: Research Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, interviewer was very informative and I was given great feed back to how to excel in future interviews. Basic behavioral questions so make sure you study up
Interview Questions: Describe a time you took initiative

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Questions asked were based on experience and knowledge of scientific methods. Interview was relatively laid back. Some behavioral questions were asked. The meeting will likely include the PI of the laboratory and the lab supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell us your experience in DNA extraction

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. Great people and friendly atmosphere. Would love to work there in the future. It was a quick interview and very straightforward. Great culture. Great peoples. They have a lot of offer. Very exciting.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yoursekf in 5 years

title: CRM Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
Tip: Your interviewers will likely start out with a question about yourself and your background to get to know you. Start out by giving them an overview of your current position or activities, then provide the most important and relevant highlights from your background that make you most qualified for the role.

Example: “Currently, I serve as the assistant to three of the company’s five executive team members, including the CEO. From my 12 years of experience as an executive assistant, I’ve developed the ability to anticipate roadblocks and create effective alternative plans.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
Tip: Your interviewers will likely start out with a question about yourself and your background to get to know you. Start out by giving them an overview of your current position or activities, then provide the most important and relevant highlights from your background that make you most qualified for the role.

Example: “Currently, I serve as the assistant to three of the company’s five executive team members, including the CEO. From my 12 years of experience as an executive assistant, I’ve developed the ability to anticipate roadblocks and create effective alternative plans.

title: Test Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hr contacted me via Phone for a Face-Face interview. Went for a group interview and after 2 months one of the group member contacted me via phone saying you have been selected and we would like you to come on board. I was happy and informed my friends and family about the job offer. I already resigned my current employer so they put me on notice. After two days the member called me and told me we cannot extend offer. Are they nuts to first say you have been selected and next we are not offering you a job.
Interview Questions: General behavioral question.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was flexible, I was hired on the spot. I was able to select my own hours and create my own courses. I was working, though, for an auxiliary unit through the University, making my role much more flexible than most.
Interview Questions: What is your experience teaching? What is your teaching style?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: A skype interview was conducted. The questions were more about previous experience regarding to position. Interviewers were pretty nice. It took nearly one a hour. The follow up interview took 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Whar was your previous research experience?

title: Residential Life Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: The process started by submitting an application that contained some essay questions about your decision making. That was followed by a 1:1 interview that lasted around 30 minutes. A very easy process.
Interview Questions: If a customer asked you a question that you didn't know the answer to, how would you respond?

title: Customer Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sit down interview with a hiring manager at the location I wanted to work at. It was about a 15-minute interview and they offered the job on the spot. Other employees agree that they'll hire pretty much anyone for a student position regardless of how good your interviewing skills are.
Interview Questions: How will you bring the values (respect, responsibility, discovery, excellence) of the university to the workplace?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: To be honest, interviews at MU vary so wildly by department that there's no way any review is going to be helpful. For getting an interview, however, be sure you figure out who the hiring manager is and reach out to him or her *after* you have submitted your application. Managers are not allowed to reviewed emailed materials, but they can read your email that you've replied and are especially hopeful for an interview.
Interview Questions: Current list of books I'm reading.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the boss briefly. He described what the job was and asked if I could do field work. It was a one on one meeting in his office and took about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are your plans after college?

title: Office Support Staff II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online (with a resume and cover letter).  And eventually, I was called in for an interview at the office (by 2 interviewers).  Only a week or two passed, between the time I applied and the day I was called.  This experience differs sharply from my experiences applying for other jobs at The University of Missouri (frequently, I was not contacted at all after submitting an application).
Interview Questions: Describe your organizational practices in an office environment.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Kansas City, MO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just normal process. Applied through reference. Sent me an email regarding placing an interview.  Called me in office. 1 question .Tell me about yourself. That's it. Just after that started explaining about roles and benefits. Asked me to mark available time. That's all
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: First exchanged a few emails, interviews had to be rescheduled because people were out sick. I went into the office on the day of my interview. It was all very informal and laid back. I was asked a few questions, then offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with working weekends?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online.  Invited in for face-to-face.  Manager was very reasonable and friendly.  Since my main duties would be receptionist and customer service in person, on the phone, and via email, then I made a point to demonstrate that I was friendly and easy going.
Interview Questions: I was asked to demonstrate some Excel skills rather than just say that I knew Excel.

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Apply online when applications are posted (You will see posters around residence hall when you can apply) After you dil out your application you will be emailed to sign up for an interview. One, 30 minute interview with a student staff supervisor. Nothing too stressful, most questions asked were related to customer service. Entire process took about 3-4 weeks to hear back after the interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with someone you don't like, how did you handle it?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Rolla, MO)
Interview Descriptions: There were two managers from the IT department that went over my resume and then asked me about some questions that helped them decide what task I would do best at.
Interview Questions: How you feel about talking to customers over the phone?

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Slow response time. They have positions open and take 1-6 months before they even start screening for candidates. They usually look for professionals that are working in the area that they know personally. Everything of course is department and college based.
Interview Questions: What courses have I taught?

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was very quick, applied, took an online assessment, received a call form HR, a couple days later interviewed w/ manger, hired on the spot, the interview was not difficult for me.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle working under pressure and conflict?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an straightforward Skype conversation. We discussed my skills and how they would fit into the project my boss was interested in pursuing. We talked for one hour, discussing possible strategies and approaches we would take if I was hired.
Interview Questions: What type of genomic data would you rather have for this project?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The professor was busy at the time of my interview and had his "go to" graduate student sit down and we talked for about 20-30 minutes. I was later brought back to interview with the actual professor who was hiring, and we essentially went over the same material on the scope and degree of what he was looking to accomplish in a short period of time.
Interview Questions: The biggest thing I felt that the professor wanted to gauge was along the lines of, "Considering how much you are already doing outside of this job, what do you think you can get done with such a short time frame?"

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Was Interviewed on phone for about 15 minutes. The hiring manager asked a series of questions. There was a rapid fire round to check how quickly I respond. The overall interview process was good and not much stressful
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was mostly behavioral questions. I thought it was going to have more technical, but only asked my experience instead of going into a lot of detail. It was very casual and it was a pretty positive experience.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you were put in a conflict and how your responded.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. They were mainly asking about interests and career goals. All you really have to do is be aware of your goals and be able to communicate them to your professor.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Geospatial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed. I already knew the management in charge of the project and they were looking for a certain group to fill these positions, and I was part of that group. The interview was more of a formality.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a time. . ."

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Single day interview. It was a very relaxed process, very nice people. Interviewed at the company, received an offer the next day. I do not need thirty words to describe the hiring and interview process, this is useless.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous internships, Strengths and weaknesses ect.

title: Quality Control Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Began with a phone interview asking about general education/experience.  About 3 days later I was invited to a formal interview.  I met with the supervisor, administrative director of the department, department manager, and HR.  I was given a tour and then got to meet some people in the group I would be working with.  Very laid back, mostly talked about my experience and what made me right for the job.
Interview Questions: Would you describe yourself as detail-oriented? Give an example.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is a very general interview and evaluate process compared to most of the major universities in the country. The interviewer are very friendly and no behavior based questions were raised.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward, easygoing and mostly behavioral questions. The interviewer, or your potential supervisor, made me feel very comfortable and at east during the process. The entire interview took no longer than 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to apply to our department?

title: Events Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the manager, whom asked several questions. Several of the questions were centered around what i would do during different situations and understanding if I have issues with authority.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you cannot get ahold of anyone and there is an issue?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Graduate Research Assistant interview was good and challenging, lots of tough questions about past work, like, have you ever been fired? why do you want to to be a Graduate Research Assistant, do you have experience as a Graduate Research Assistant and things of that nature. I liked the people who interviewed me, they were really friendly.
Interview Questions: do you have experience as a Graduate Research Assistant

title: Site Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy. They are pretty desperate for finding people to fill these positions so any one that applies basically gets the job. I don't know why i need to write 30 more words for this interview thing. So
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Talk to professor in person.
Submit Letter of Interest to explain why you want to apply for this role.
You must be really good in the professor's class to be considered as a candidate.
Interview Questions: What's your future plan related to this RA role?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: phone interview in the first place, and then get an offer letter. You probably could get some fellowship if you check on the graduate school website. The interview is very unformal. I don't think it happen very often.
Interview Questions: Why you choose our university

title: Venture Out Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and comfortable. Allowed for the opportunity to let your true nature show. It was a series of paper cuts, individual interviews, and team interviews. The interviews made you think outside of the box and wanted to challenge your creative process. They also measured how you worked and adapted with the team.
Interview Questions: You notice a client is in a dangerous situation ( i.e. about to fall, not strapped in correctly, etc) how would you address the situation?

title: Retail Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call to come in and interview. Basic interview as well as a math skills test counting money and putting things in alphabetical order. Really easy interview with basic questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Calc Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process, submitted my application online, called a few weeks later and write away was asked a time i could come in to interview. did not even have to take a math test, kind of strange now that I think about it.  the manager just asked me my availability and about my math experience, he told me i got the job right away and i filled out an availiability form and started tutoring right away, really awesome cool yeah
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult

title: Front Desk Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interviewing process was very relaxed and informal. I was interviewed by current Desk Attendants and Supervisors. I enjoyed the interview process and the current staff members were very informative about the position and its benefits.  The interview also gave me valuable insight into the type of experiences that current Desk Attendant encounter. I enjoyed the interview and I would suggest and advice anyone applying for this position to just speak from your experiences and be honest.
Interview Questions: A lot of customer service based questions related to past experiences

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour with advising colleagues and campus partners, questions similar to NACADA prep questions, had questions related to personality and fit to current group, required written statement prior to in person interview
Interview Questions: How do you define success in academic advising?

title: Textile Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very easy.  I sent in my resume to the supervisor and she called and we spoke on the phone for a few minutes and offered me the job the next day.
Interview Questions: Explain your past experience.

title: Office Support Staff II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: This was a simple interview process with straight-forwads questions. The first interview was with the administrative lead and the second interview included the director. Because it was an office support job, questions revolved around administrative duties.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with grants?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was very straightforward. It was a work study position and I was a freshman so the interview was basically asking about my personality and any basic office skill I might have
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was good at keeping things confidential because I would be handling student record.

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: In the interview, I was asked behavioral based questions to test my conflict management skills. They also wanted to know about previous positions I held and what competencies I developed in those previous roles. The most important qualities that they search for in this interview are time management and peer management skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver bad news to a customer or peer

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: First emailed the director of football operations to set up the meeting with one of the graduate assistants. When it came time for the interview, I went up to the facility and sat with the GA for about 15 minutes while he explained the job and asked me questions.
Interview Questions: How will you be able to handle working here and staying committed to your education

title: Media Relations Asitant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Application submitted then I waited for about a week and I recieved a phone call asking to come into their office for an interview. it was a  one on one in person interview, wa very informal but the interviewer was a great guy and made you feel comfortable working there.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Process took around 2+ weeks and I met with the hiring manager, and HR representatives, and spoke about the qualifications and why I was a good fit for the organization.
Interview Questions: Very standard questions. Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: you have to undergo GTA workshop
Interview Questions: Make a 10mins presentation of whatever topic you choose to teach

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: I was assigned as a teaching assistant when I was accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: The assistantship is not guaranteed.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: At the very beginning, I was told that I need to find an assistantship by myself. Then, I was told that I would have 0.25 assistantship working as a graduate teaching assistant.
Interview Questions: Since I was assigned as a graduate teaching assistant, it was hard for me to answer this question.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: In math department, since they need lots of people to teach, you basically just need to show them that you have the ability to teach. There are basically just one part in the interview process: mini teaching demo. You need to prepare for a 10 to 15 mins presentation for college algebra level material. You don't have to finish all the stuff they give you (they will email you the material 1 to 2 weeks ahead of time.) just go as slow and as detailed as possible.
Interview Questions: Not so much. Just pretend you are a good elementary school teacher

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was sat down in a room with the Laboratory manager and the two post doctorate scientists the position would be working under. I was asked about my understanding and experience of general lab practices and techniques, and was then given a tour of the entire lab.
Interview Questions: What are some of the lab techniques that you have experience performing?

title: Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a little bizarre - initial interview was 2-hours with various management members - second interview included direct reports....that seemed bizarre. pretty involved for a lower / middle management job.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral based questions - describe a time when...

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (University City, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: ask me couple of questions about customer services and do some math problems with calculator
Interview Questions: What you will do if some customers are complaining?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It varies by different professors. The professor gave me a test problem and I needed to go through a paper and write program to solve it. It was not a hard one, you can choose any programming language to write the program.  After you successfully demonstrate your idea, you can start working in the lab if he agrees.
Interview Questions: Go through a paper and solve the related problem and write a program.

title: Finance Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Some brief questions about my background.  Overall, it was not complex, they wanted to be sure I was capable of teaching.  There is a course coordinator now, so the process may be different than it was when I started.  So long as basic concepts are understood, there shouldn't be a problem.
Interview Questions: Describe your past teaching experience?

title: Advancement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening followed by panel interview and often there is a 3rd interview with the department head and hiring manager.  Interview process takes an average of 2-3 months.  Panel interviewers have a set of 9 questions to ask each candidate - you may do well to expand upon each of the questions to the fullest extent.
Interview Questions: You will be asked to describe in 'metrics' your success in previous positions held.

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Yellow fur trim paint and a green blossom. Fruit was never a ding at the bell, but then donkey wow definitely issue lasers two for new. I then went into the great outdoors and fought two fish tank tops. Dadaism is a forte of the priests of Little Italy. Internet's okay but just don't tell the president.
Interview Questions: Have you ever drank Cocaine-Cola?

title: College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview as well as a one on one interview with the director. It was people from the university who had previously done the position and were in the same field. I t was not intimidating and they asked me questions about my passions and goals and even fears. it was a great time full of laughs and it inspired me.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about the current status of education?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sit-Down Interview with two people I would report to. I applied and I believe there were a handful of other candidates. I was able to get an interview and sat down with them for about a half hour. I believe i was qualified so the interview was largely just to make sure I understood the work expectations and the requirements of my class schedule so I could be the most help.
Interview Questions: Why I chose my degrees in school

title: Office Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward and simple interview process. Two-on-one interview took place with existing Office Support plus supervisor. Formal, but not excessively. Interviewers were polite and civil but somewhat impersonal, not to an unusual degree. Started with explanation of position and expectations before inquiries about relevant experience. The process took approximately half an hour. Offer came within roughly two weeks.
Interview Questions: Q: Greatest strength and weakness?

title: OSS IIII Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: Great but the interview included current team members as well and some women can ce judgement or give you the cold shoulder.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Peer Advisor/Student Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, then you go through a candidate class where you learn about the position with other candidates, you then will interview with a hall coordinator and a student staff member.
Interview Questions: What educational interaction would you implement in your community?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri
Interview Descriptions: relax, and make sure you tell them your past job experiences.
Interview Questions: why should we hire you

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the manager , Doctor and staff in the clinic asked a lot of questions and it was nice to meet the team in that clinic, knowing I would be there every day with them.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in pain medicine?

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick, easy, and very relaxed. The store manager and her overseeing manager asked me very simple questions about my past work experience and customer service skills. After they deemed me fit for the job they asked some questions about time constraints and scheduling.
Interview Questions: How often do you want to work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Rolla, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I contacted my adviser through email, submit my resume, application, GRE & TOEFL score, objective of study. It is a pretty standard process.After around two months, I get the job offer from my advisor.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this position?

title: Research Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the employer that wanted to hire me one on one. Interview was brief and to the point. Was very easy to talk to and get to know the interviewer. They had great questions for me and appreciated my questions as well.
Interview Questions: What could you do for this company?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, Interviewed by 5 different people,Pleasant,The chair person is a great guy, very friendly and collegiate atmosphere, Would highly recommend anyone, very supportive of the faculty and the staff
Interview Questions: Why Missouri Columbia?

title: Director Affirmative Action Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Kansas City, MO) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview covered from 7am to 7pm, including a luncheon interview. During the 12 hours the interviews were in one hour increments that included a minimum of 30 faculty and 30 staff from all schools/ departments of the university and the Associate Vice Chancellor of Affirmative Action, the Chancellor of the University of Missouri- Kansas City.
Interview Questions: Describe my experience designing/implementing Affirmative Action Plans in conformance with OFCCP

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I suspect that the primary reason that I got this interview was because of internal connections, though I had to pass through HR screening first so I was qualified for the position. I found the whole process fairly painless, actually. The people I interviewed with were kind and supportive throughout the process.  Other than the usual case of nerves, I found that this interview prepared me well for the job and for future interviews.
Interview Questions: Nothing was out of the ordinary for the field and most questions were fairly general.  The questions were essentially the same for the phone and on-campus interviews.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and relaxed. Interviewer made me feel very comfortable. I was offered the job immediately and accepted. This was, however, part of my work-study position so it was far less formal than a traditional interview/hiring process.
Interview Questions: Do you know what LGBTQ stands for?

title: User Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was a opening listed under "job openings" or "careers" page on the university website. It was straightforward: create an online applicant account, submit your resume, and if the hiring department is interested, they'll call you by phone and schedule an interview. This all happened in about a week after my initial submission. The first interview was actually a two sessions in one. First I met the actual IT department I would work with, then I interviewed with some of the faculty and staff I would support. I was asked to come in again on a separate date to interview with the dean of the school I was applying for, and speak with only him that day. About a week later I was asked to visit again and was then officially offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your personality. What are your strengths? How would you address a wireless issue on a student's laptop? How do you handle multiple requests? What would upset you the most during the job? If you disagreed with your supervisor, how would you handle this?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: $13/hr without bounce, but with full tuition waive.
Interview Questions: Require strong bio science background, which I am not good at.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Overall the interview went well.Group interview with basic interview questions. Nice interviewers with quite location for interview. Questions: introduce yourself, major, year of study, advisor's name, etc
What are your strengths,
What are your previous research experience. 
What do you know about our department.
What did you learn from your mistakes.
What courses have you taken
Interview Questions: such as, what is your biggest obstacle you have encountered, how do you deal with them.

title: Chemical Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a very informal setting. I was sat down in the office of the professor who would be my advisor. We talked a lot about what my goals were as an intern there and he asked me a lot about my experiences. We discussed rules and proper functioning of my role as an intern and what events I was expected to attend. We discussed what hours I would work as well.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations for this internship and what experiences do you hope to gain?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was phone interview and lasted for 15 minutes. Questions were straight forward and was not difficult to answer. Question were based on present work and how best i can handle it
Interview Questions: About my expertise and willing to take the Job

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial description of position in the interviews was very different than what the job and the co-worker situation actually turned out to be. After making an expensive and difficult move across the country for the job, I discovered in the first month the expectations were a moving target and unrealistic and that supervisors had no idea how to evaluate my type of work (research for businesses).
Interview Questions: incompetent supervisors, vitriolic gatekeepers perpetuating groupthink among the management team, complete lack of trust and any real collaboration. Much like junior high.

title: Computer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: A fairly standard phone interview followed up by additional discussions.  We discussed my relevant job experience.  We also discussed a few support scenarios and ran through some 'what-if' arrangements. There was some personal banter and discussions about future plans and intentions.
Interview Questions: Investigated previous support experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Rolla, MO) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very good systematic and friendly approach to hiring. Started from basic to in-depth knowledge testing. It is an experience of life time. Integrated questions from various subjects. ultimately it went well. Very patient interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
You go through group training first, which is basically a test to see how sociable you can be. My advice is to just be friendly and outgoing during the meetings, they're easy enough to get through.

Afterwards, you interview with specific Hall Coordinators, This is a standard process, but most HCs will only hire candidates they have interviewed personally, so pick your hall carefully.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to balance ResHall life and teaching a FIG for the students who live around you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the advisor you work under. For me I literally explained what I did as an undergraduate and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Explain what I did as an undergraduate student.

title: Student Techinacal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then 1:1 interview. He asked me to send previous projects that i have done from school. A week later i got a call then i accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: How do i resolve the conflict with supervisor?

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: first of phone interview, then group interview with professor and supersior, then got the job..it's not compicated and quick process
Interview Questions: What's your professor skill

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I hade three interviews. The first one was a phone interview where they asked me to talk about my experiences. The second one was a in person interview with my supervisor and she asked me behavioral question. The third was the final one with the Dean and he asked how I and students will benefit from hiring me.
Interview Questions: If a student came in and said they wanted to drop out of school, how would you address the situation.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Rolla, MO) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: application online; phone interview; web interview; offer
Interview Questions: What is your career goal? what challenges you most?

title: Learning Architect Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Straight forward
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Visit the University website to find out more about Graduate Degree Program Application Instructions. Your program of interest sets the application deadline, eligibility criteria and required application materials beyond what the Graduate School must receive. Extra materials may include a program-specific application, letters of recommendation, a statement of purpose and/or a resume.
Interview Questions: The Graduate School requires official TOEFL or IELTS scores, sent directly from the testing service provider, for all applicants who come from areas where English is not the primary language. Learn more about the proficiency test requirement and proof-of-funding documents, and check your eligibility on our International Applicants page.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Immediate, on-the-spot, informal interview was available once I came to the office and filled out an application.  It was a fairly low-end college job, after all.  I was hired immediately at the interview.  Work then started a few weeks later at the beginning of the fall semester, since the interview took place during the summer.
Interview Questions: Quite straight-forward, typical questions.

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions:
What skills you have?
Cashier experiences
Interview Questions: Computer skills

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I saw a posting for the position on a bulletin board and submitted my resume.  I was invited to a group interview where we were divided into three groups.  We had to go through a series of activities.  I then received an invitation to an additional interview with me and a panel of three employers.  I was offered the position within the week.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you didn't know the answer to something?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly long and drawn out. Typical phone interview, then face to face interview. Expect to show a portfolio.
Interview Questions: Stereotypical questions are asked...nothing you shouldn't expect

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri (Columbia, MO) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions:
1. Email me to describe the position and effective day.
2. After my response, a phone interview has been arranged.
3. During the phone interview, several basic question has been asked like the background, paper, personal interest, why choose the current location and the goal university
